name: Zopiclone
summary: Zopiclone is a non-benzodiazepine hypnotic used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.
description: Zopiclone, marketed under the brand name Imovane (and others), is a cyclopyrrolone-class sedative-hypnotic indicated for short-term management of insomnia characterized by difficulty falling asleep, frequent nocturnal awakenings, or early morning awakenings. It acts as a GABA-A receptor agonist at the benzodiazepine binding site, enhancing the inhibitory neurotransmitter effect of GABA in the central nervous system. Zopiclone is typically prescribed for brief periods (2–4 weeks) due to the risk of tolerance, dependence, and withdrawal.

contraindications: History of complex sleep behaviors with hypnotics

items: Short-term treatment of insomnia characterized by difficulty falling asleep, frequent awakenings, or early morning awakenings

sections.text: Binds to the benzodiazepine site of the GABA-A receptor complex, enhancing GABAergic inhibition and producing sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant effects.

adult.oral: Usual starting dose is 7.5 mg once daily at bedtime; in elderly or hepatic impairment, start at 3.75 mg.

low_dose_sleep.oral: 3.75 mg at bedtime may be used for mild insomnia or in sensitive patients.

sections.text: Onset within 30 minutes; duration of action approximately 6–8 hours.

other: Risk of tolerance, dependence, and withdrawal with prolonged use
Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants
Contraindicated in severe hepatic impairment or respiratory depression

sections.pregnancy: Limited human data; avoid unless benefit outweighs risk
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; avoid or use with caution
sections.geriatrics: Start at lower dose (3.75 mg) to reduce fall and confusion risk

sections.text: Gradually reduce dose over 1–2 weeks to minimize withdrawal symptoms.

items: Intended for short-term use only (≤4 weeks)
Low-dose (3.75 mg) may be effective for sleep onset in mild insomnia
Avoid abrupt discontinuation after prolonged use
